item.title: #en @ 1500969723051352067
item.description:
As part of NYC Open Data week, join members from the Computational Science Center (@barnard_csc) and Cyber Collective to think through the ethics of using public data! ğŸ’»ğŸ’­
When: March 10, 6-7:30pm ğŸ—“ï¸ Where: Virtual Register now: https://t.co/1Rmobpe9DA https://t.co/WPXubgxXFg

item.title: #en @ 1500958350292307969
item.description:
Excited to (finally!) share that I'm consulting to @USAFacts. I have a lot of respect for their work on helping constituents and governments access accurate data trends. Thrilled to work with the team!
Working on new programs to expand open data access in the USA!

item.title: #en @ 1500951752107073539
item.description:
The LooksRare Story has brought out an immense amount of data driven insights that have been negative for the project.
Whether you like it or not, in web3 you can't hide the truth.
Bullish on objective reporting, citizen journalism and open data for everyone. https://t.co/tuuBggz8xS

item.description: This week! Join us online on March 10 for "NYC Crime Statistics and the Politics of Open Data," a free educational lecture by @tamaranopper, plus a conversation with @dreanyc123. item.title: #en @ 1500864969042276353
item.description: It's been 10 years since the signing of NYC's Open Data Law. The level of transparency I was demanding with my legislation at the time seemed radical, but we see today how impactful it can be to open up government to people. #OpenData #nycSoData https://t.co/PfqSMEaQtw

item.description:
